titleStmt.title: By the Queene. Whereas by the auncient treaties of entrecourses, which from time to time haue bene renewed betweene the Queenes Maiestie our most gracious soueraigne lady, and diuers of her highnes most noble progenitors, kings of this realme, and the princes and lordes of the lowe Countries ...
Proclamations. 1579-02-28
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.

titleStmt.title: By the Queene. Whereas by the auncient treaties of entrecourses, which from time to time haue bene renewed betweene the Queenes Maiestie our most gracious soueraigne lady, and diuers of her highnes most noble progenitors, kings of this realme, and the princes and lordes of the lowe Countries ...
Proclamations. 1579-02-28
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
Elizabeth I, Queen of England, 1533-1603.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Christopher Barker, printer to the Queenes Maiestie [i.e. B. Norton and J. Bill],

notesStmt.note: For the drying of wool fells.
Actual printers' names and suggested publication date from STC.
Proclamation dated: "the xxviii. day of February, in the one and twentieth yeere of her raigne".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
